dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my god. You are not going to believe this!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my god. You are not going to believe this!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: What is it now? Another, uh, end-of-the-world scenario?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What is it now? Another, uh, end-of-the-world scenario?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Almaty, right? Vehicle inspections. Like, two hundred thousand of them. And guess what?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Almaty, right? Vehicle inspections. Like, two hundred thousand of them. And guess what?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In 2024, nearly 205,000 vehicle inspections were conducted at environmental checkpoints in Almaty.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: What? Don't leave me, uh, hanging.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What? Don't leave me, uh, hanging.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Seventeen percent of them, over thirty-four thousand cars, still exceed toxicity limits. Still.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seventeen percent of them, over thirty-four thousand cars, still exceed toxicity limits. Still.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to checkpoint staff, 34,708 vehicles (17 percent) were found to exceed the permissible levels of toxicity and smoke emissions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, but, um, isn't that actually a decrease? Didn't it say it was, like, twenty percent before?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, but, um, isn't that actually a decrease? Didn't it say it was, like, twenty percent before?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While in 2020, the share of polluting cars exceeded 20 percent, it has now dropped to 17 percent.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, from twenty to seventeen. Three percent. Whoop-de-doo. Still thousands of cars choking the city.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, from twenty to seventeen. Three percent. Whoop-de-doo. Still thousands of cars choking the city.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But the fact that it's decreasing is, uh, it's a positive trend. Right? Like, they're doing something.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the fact that it's decreasing is, uh, it's a positive trend. Right? Like, they're doing something.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, they're doing something. Issuing thirty-one thousand fines. That'll, you know, fix everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, they're doing something. Issuing thirty-one thousand fines. That'll, you know, fix everything.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: More than 31,600 administrative protocols were issued against violators.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, but listen! The Prime Minister, he actually, um, he publicly named the main source of air pollution in Almaty.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but listen! The Prime Minister, he actually, um, he publicly named the main source of air pollution in Almaty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, we reported that the prime minister named the main source of air pollution in Almaty. In response to a parliamentary inquiry, Kazakhstan's Prime Minister Olzhas Bektenov identified the primary factor contributing to Almaty™s environmental deterioration.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The Prime Minister. Naming the obvious. Wow. What'd he say, like, exhaust fumes?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Prime Minister. Naming the obvious. Wow. What'd he say, like, exhaust fumes?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, but that's big! It puts a, like, a spotlight on it. For policy. For funding.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but that's big! It puts a, like, a spotlight on it. For policy. For funding.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh huh. So, more inspections. More fines. More numbers next year that don't really change anything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh huh. So, more inspections. More fines. More numbers next year that don't really change anything.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But it's progress! It’s, um, acknowledging the problem. That’s step one, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's progress! It's, um, acknowledging the problem. That's step one, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Sure. Step one. Wake me when we get to, like, step ten.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Sure. Step one. Wake me when we get to, like, step ten.
